title: [Large-scale] Social Information Literacy Competency Enhancement Program for Practitioners: Focused on Civic Engagement and Social Responsibility

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental computer literacy and information retrieval experience, basic comprehension of social systems (politics, economy, culture), and recognition of fundamental rights and duties in civil society
context.additional_context: A program cultivating information analysis, evaluation, and utilization skills for working professionals to improve job efficiency. Structured around practical exercises using digital devices. Through case studies on solving community problems, learners gain an in-depth understanding of social relationships and institutional contexts, with a focus on strengthening practical competencies via citizen-participatory project design.

learning_goals: Learners critically evaluate diverse information sources to select reliable materials in social contexts and make comprehensive judgments considering historical cases and cultural variables.
Learners systematically search and synthesize information applicable to workplace problems, integrating economic, political, cultural, and institutional contexts.
Learners visualize information analysis results using digital tools and effectively communicate solutions to community issues through citizen-participatory communication strategies.

Learners will understand information ethics principles, apply them in practical contexts from a social responsibility perspective (e.g., data privacy, copyright), and explore strategies to protect citizens' rights.

resources: Database Package for Information Retrieval Practice

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
